result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A Schwersenska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Craig A Schwersenska is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Craig A Schwersenska was found guilty of DISORDERLY CONDUCT - 1ST OFFENSE. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Craig A Schwersenska was found guilty of Possession of Drug Paraphernalia 1st. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig A Schwersenska

records.addlTxt:
3:55 PM Defendant Craig A Schwersenska appeared by phone.  Attorney Paul Douglas Polacek appeared by video for Craig A Schwersenska.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Polacek states that the matter is resolved; defendant will plea to two county ordinance charges.  Atty Burdon moves to dismiss the criminal and substitute to county ordinance violation on Count 1 to 50.03 Disorderly Conduct and Count 2 to 50.11 Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.

BY THE COURT:  Based on the request of the State, court will dismiss the criminal and substitute to county ordinance violation on Count 1 to 50.03 Disorderly Conduct and Count 2 to 50.11 Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.

Atty Polacek enters a No Contest plea.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the plea, finds the defendant guilty of Count 1,  50.03 Disorderly Conduct with a forfeiture of $267.50 and Count 2, 50.11 Possession of Drug Paraphernalia with a forfeiture of $267.50.
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the COC office

Status hearing on May 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

02:55 PM Defendant Craig A Schwersenska in court.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Atty Burdon states that an offer was sent to the defendant.  Defendant did receive it but does not wish to accept it.  Defendant has been speaking with Atty Polacek and has a meeting on Friday with him and will most likely retain him.

BY THE COURT:  Set another status  Status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
*No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney and has received an offer from the State.  Court questions defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant has freely, voluntarily & intelligently waived his right to counsel.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

02:35 PM Defendant Craig A Schwersenska appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
  Court confirms address and phone.
Atty Juech requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500.00 signature bond with conditions.  Status hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
